<br>

:::columns
::: {.column width="50%"}
![](images/heart.gif){width="800px"}
:::
::: {.column width="40%"}
- The volume of the atria and ventricles increases the heart's morphology from the start of the race to two days after the race.
- From two days after the race, the heart's morphology begins to decrease until ten days after the race, at which point the heart returns to its normal size
:::

Dataset presentation

## Dataset presentation

<br>

:::columns

::: {.column width="40%"}

**Data collection time points**
![](images/visites.png){width="80%"}
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
**Variables of the study :**

- General informations on ultra trailers (age, weight...)
- Information on their performance during the race (rank...)
- About 20 variables on the health of their body
- More than 50 heart variables 


<h2>↓</h2>

![](images/coeurcourt.png){.absolute bottom=380 right=20 width="200" height="200"}

<div style="height: 10px"></div>

**Variables of interests :**

- Left atrial volume & Right atrial volume   
- Left ventricle volume & Right ventricle volume   
- Right ventricle filing surface & Left ventricle filing surface
- Ejection fraction

:::

:::

Objectives of the project

## Objectives of the project

<br>

:::columns

::: {.column width="80%"}
**Analyze and model the evolution of heart morphology over the time according several dimensions**

<div style="height: 35px;"></div>

- Does the race have an effect on the evolution of cardiac parameters ?
- Is there significant inter-individual variability ?
- What about intra-individual variability ?
